segment.source: title: Step 7: Export and import a virtual machine
segment.target: title: Step 7: Export and import a virtual machine

segment.source: Step 7: Export and import a virtual machine
segment.target: Step 7: Export and import a virtual machine

segment.source: 12-Nov update.Test update to validate Bug 451748.
segment.target: 12-Nov update.Test update to validate Bug 451748.

segment.source: You can quickly copy a virtual machine or move a virtual machine by using the export and import functionality.
segment.target: You can quickly copy a virtual machine or move a virtual machine by using the export and import functionality.

segment.source: Export the VM
segment.target: Export the VM

segment.source: Exporting a virtual machine exports all of the pieces of the VM, including the checkpoints.
segment.target: Exporting a virtual machine exports all of the pieces of the VM, including the checkpoints.

segment.source: In Hyper-V Manager, right-click the virtual machine and select Export.
segment.target: In Hyper-V Manager, right-click the virtual machine and select Export.

segment.source: Click Browse in the dialog box and navigate to C:\Users\Public and then click Select Folder.
segment.target: Click Browse in the dialog box and navigate to C:\Users\Public and then click Select Folder.

segment.source: In the Export Virtual Machine dialog, make sure the path looks okay and then click Export.
segment.target: In the Export Virtual Machine dialog, make sure the path looks okay and then click Export.

segment.source: While the VM is being exported, you can see the progress in the Status section:
segment.target: While the VM is being exported, you can see the progress in the Status section:

segment.source: Did the export work?
segment.target: Did the export work?

segment.source: To verify that the virtual machine was exported, right-click on your Start menu and select File Explorer.
segment.target: To verify that the virtual machine was exported, right-click on your Start menu and select File Explorer.

segment.source: Navigate to C:\Users\Public\Windows Walkthrough VM.
segment.target: Navigate to C:\Users\Public\Windows Walkthrough VM.

segment.source: You should see another folder called Windows Walkthrough VM and inside that folder should be three folders with the files for your exported virtual machine:
segment.target: You should see another folder called Windows Walkthrough VM and inside that folder should be three folders with the files for your exported virtual machine:

segment.source: Snapshots
segment.target: Snapshots

segment.source: Virtual Hard Disks
segment.target: Virtual Hard Disks

segment.source: Virtual Machines
segment.target: Virtual Machines

segment.source: Import the VM
segment.target: Import the VM

segment.source: Before we import the VM, we are going to delete the original VM.
segment.target: Before we import the VM, we are going to delete the original VM.

segment.source: Right-click on the VM and select Delete.
segment.target: Right-click on the VM and select Delete.

segment.source: In Hyper-V Manager, in the Action menu, click Import Virtual Machine.
segment.target: In Hyper-V Manager, in the Action menu, click Import Virtual Machine.

segment.source: In the Locate Folder section, click Browse and navigate to C:\Users\Public\Windows Walkthrough VM and then click Next.
segment.target: In the Locate Folder section, click Browse and navigate to C:\Users\Public\Windows Walkthrough VM and then click Next.

segment.source: In the Select virtual machine to import screen click Next.
segment.target: In the Select virtual machine to import screen click Next.

segment.source: In the Choose Import Type section, select Register the virtual machine in place and then click Next.
segment.target: In the Choose Import Type section, select Register the virtual machine in place and then click Next.

segment.source: In the Choose Destination section, leave the default and click Next.
segment.target: In the Choose Destination section, leave the default and click Next.

segment.source: In Choose Storage folders, leave the default path and click Next.
segment.target: In Choose Storage folders, leave the default path and click Next.

segment.source: On the summary page you'll see a list of the paths where the new VM files will be located.
segment.target: On the summary page you'll see a list of the paths where the new VM files will be located.

segment.source: Click Finish to start the import.
segment.target: Click Finish to start the import.

segment.source: Did the import work?
segment.target: Did the import work?

segment.source: To make sure the import worked, just double-click the VM in Hyper-V Manager and launch VMConnect to check the VM.
segment.target: To make sure the import worked, just double-click the VM in Hyper-V Manager and launch VMConnect to check the VM.
